TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCParticleSystem extends Cocos2D.CCNode implements class Cocos2D.ICCBlendProtocol, class Cocos2D.ICCTextureProtocol

Docs.summary: Particle System base class. Attributes of a Particle System:
Docs.remarks: <para> <list type="bullet"> <item> <description>emission rate of the particles</description> </item> <item> <description>Gravity Mode (Mode A):</description> </item> <item> <description>gravity</description> </item> <item> <description>direction</description> </item> <item> <description>speed +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>tangential acceleration +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>radial acceleration +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>Radius Mode (Mode B):</description> </item> <item> <description>startRadius +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>endRadius +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>rotate +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>Properties common to all modes:</description> </item> <item> <description>life +- life variance</description> </item> <item> <description>start spin +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>end spin +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>start size +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>end size +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>start color +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>end color +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>life +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>blending function</description> </item> <item> <description>texture</description> </item> </list> </para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>emission rate of the particles</description> </item> <item> <description>Gravity Mode (Mode A):</description> </item> <item> <description>gravity</description> </item> <item> <description>direction</description> </item> <item> <description>speed +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>tangential acceleration +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>radial acceleration +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>Radius Mode (Mode B):</description> </item> <item> <description>startRadius +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>endRadius +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>rotate +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>Properties common to all modes:</description> </item> <item> <description>life +- life variance</description> </item> <item> <description>start spin +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>end spin +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>start size +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>end size +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>start color +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>end color +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>life +- variance</description> </item> <item> <description>blending function</description> </item> <item> <description>texture</description> </item> </list><para>emission rate of the particles</para><para>Gravity Mode (Mode A):</para><para>gravity</para><para>direction</para><para>speed +- variance</para><para>tangential acceleration +- variance</para><para>radial acceleration +- variance</para><para>Radius Mode (Mode B):</para><para>startRadius +- variance</para><para>endRadius +- variance</para><para>rotate +- variance</para><para>Properties common to all modes:</para><para>life +- life variance</para><para>start spin +- variance</para><para>end spin +- variance</para><para>start size +- variance</para><para>end size +- variance</para><para>start color +- variance</para><para>end color +- variance</para><para>life +- variance</para><para>blending function</para><para>texture</para><para> <ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref> also supports particles generated by Particle Designer (<ulink url="http://particledesigner.71squared.com/">http://particledesigner.71squared.com/</ulink>). 'Radius Mode' in Particle Designer uses a fixed emit rate of 30 hz. Since that can't be guaranteed in <ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref>, <ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref> uses a another approach, but the results are almost identical.</para><ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref><ulink url="http://particledesigner.71squared.com/">http://particledesigner.71squared.com/</ulink><ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref><ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref><para> <ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref> supports all the variables used by Particle Designer plus a bit more:<list type="bullet"><item><description>spinning particles (supported when using ParticleSystemQuad)</description></item><item><description>tangential acceleration (Gravity mode)</description></item><item><description>radial acceleration (Gravity mode)</description></item><item><description>radius direction (Radius mode) (Particle Designer supports outwards to inwards direction only)</description></item></list></para><ref refid="namespacecocos2d" kindref="compound">cocos2d</ref><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>spinning particles (supported when using ParticleSystemQuad)</description> </item> <item> <description>tangential acceleration (Gravity mode)</description> </item> <item> <description>radial acceleration (Gravity mode)</description> </item> <item> <description>radius direction (Radius mode) (Particle Designer supports outwards to inwards direction only)</description> </item> </list><para>spinning particles (supported when using <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCParticleSystemQuad" />)</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCParticleSystemQuad" /><para>tangential acceleration (Gravity mode)</para><para>radial acceleration (Gravity mode)</para><para>radius direction (Radius mode) (Particle Designer supports outwards to inwards direction only)</para><para>It is possible to customize any of the above mentioned properties in runtime. Example:</para><para> <programlisting> <codeline> <highlight class="normal">emitter.radialAccel<sp />=<sp />15;</highlight> </codeline> <codeline> <highlight class="normal">emitter.startSpin<sp />=<sp />0;</highlight> </codeline> </programlisting> </para><programlisting> <codeline> <highlight class="normal">emitter.radialAccel<sp />=<sp />15;</highlight> </codeline> <codeline> <highlight class="normal">emitter.startSpin<sp />=<sp />0;</highlight> </codeline> </programlisting><codeline> <highlight class="normal">emitter.radialAccel<sp />=<sp />15;</highlight> </codeline><highlight class="normal">emitter.radialAccel<sp />=<sp />15;</highlight><sp /><sp /><codeline> <highlight class="normal">emitter.startSpin<sp />=<sp />0;</highlight> </codeline><highlight class="normal">emitter.startSpin<sp />=<sp />0;</highlight><sp /><sp />

Docs.summary: creates an initializes a ParticleSystem from a plist file. This plist files can be created manually or with Particle Designer: http://particledesigner.71squared.com/v2.0

public override float Rotation { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Sets the rotation (angle) of the node in degrees.
Docs.remarks: <para>Sets the rotation (angle) of the node in degrees.</para><para>0 is the default rotation angle. Positive values rotate node clockwise, and negative values for anti-clockwise.</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>rotation</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The rotation of the node in degrees. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>rotation</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The rotation of the node in degrees. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>rotation</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>rotation</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>The rotation of the node in degrees. </para> </parameterdescription><para>The rotation of the node in degrees. </para>

MemberSignature.Value: public override float Scale { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes both X and Y scale factor of the node.
Docs.remarks: <para>Changes both X and Y scale factor of the node.</para><para>1.0 is the default scale factor. It modifies the X and Y scale at the same time.</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>scale</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor for both X and Y axis. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>scale</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor for both X and Y axis. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>scale</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>scale</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor for both X and Y axis. </para> </parameterdescription><para>The scale factor for both X and Y axis. </para>

MemberSignature.Value: public override float ScaleX { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes the scale factor on X axis of this node
Docs.remarks: <para>Changes the scale factor on X axis of this node</para><para>The deafult value is 1.0 if you haven't changed it before</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>fScaleX</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor on X axis. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>fScaleX</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor on X axis. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>fScaleX</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>fScaleX</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor on X axis. </para> </parameterdescription><para>The scale factor on X axis. </para>

MemberSignature.Value: public override float ScaleY { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes the scale factor on Y axis of this node
Docs.remarks: <para>Changes the scale factor on Y axis of this node</para><para>The Default value is 1.0 if you haven't changed it before.</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>fScaleY</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor on Y axis. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>fScaleY</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor on Y axis. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>fScaleY</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>fScaleY</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>The scale factor on Y axis. </para> </parameterdescription><para>The scale factor on Y axis. </para>
